name: JW Marriott Essex House New York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at this hotel after doing much research and comparison between this and similar hotels in NYC. We live on Long Island, and have stayed at several other highly rated NYC hotels, such as the Casablanca and Hilton hotels.
reviews.title: Will not return to this hotel.

likes.liked: — Cleanliness and appearance of the room.

reviews.text: We picked the Central Park King room based on the hotel website description stating that the Park view rooms offer "dramatic views of New York’s famed Central Park" and "present exquisite views of Central Park, so be sure to reserve your lavish Park View Room." As we were celebrating our anniversary, decided to spend the extra $100 for the highly esteemed "Central Park View", and had requested a high floor.
reviews.title: Very comfortable stay at the Essex House

likes.liked: — The service, the location, the bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived early 11:30 am at the hotel, and were told that our room was on the 5th floor, which was at the "tree line". We asked if there were any other rooms available on a higher floor, but was told that there were not.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel, beautiful, extremely quiet, classy!

reviews.text: While the room was lovely and very clean and quiet, the air conditioning did not work well, and would not go below 67 degrees. The Central Park View which we had been promised ended up being a view of some very large trees, with no park view whatsoever (see my picture included with this review). With the telescope provided in the room, we could see the leaves on the tree. Not very exciting, and definitely not worth the extra money. If I wanted to look at trees, I could have done so elsewhere for a lot less money.
reviews.title: Beautiful - great location - very nice staff

likes.disliked: — Couldn't figure out how to have bright lights in the room. Difficult for getting dressed.

reviews.text: We contacted the manager on duty to let her know that we were disappointed with our stay, but she made no attempt to compensate us whatsoever. In fact, she tried to blame us by saying that we had booked the room on the same day. While I can understand that there may not have been any other rooms available given our last minute booking, we still should have received what we thought we were paying for, and that was, according to their website, "lavish" and "exquisite" views of Central Park. In my opinion, if they are going to have rooms with a tree obstructed view of Central Park, they should list them on their website as "obstructed view rooms" or the like, so that the consumer is not mislead into expecting something better than a tree view.
reviews.title: Overrated

reviews.text: Having lived in the UAE for the past four years, I was excited to stay at the Jumeirah Essex hotel in NYC. I have had great experiences at many Jumeirah hotels but unfortunately, this location doesn't live up to their standards. I had a small (even by NY standards) room that had too much furniture jammed into it. The bathroom was old and didn't function very well. There were millions of light switches that you had to navigate every night - picky, I know, but when I arrived from LHR at 2 am it was not a fun game to play. I have stayed in much more luxurious hotels in NY for this same rate.
reviews.title: Great staff, rooms unworthy of Jumeirah name

reviews.text: The only thing that saved this from a lower rating was the staff. Every single person I came into contact with was fabulous. The doormen, reception, room service, the waiters, and the cleaning staff all went out of their way to make me feel comfortable and well taken care off.
reviews.title: Service at your fingertips!

reviews.text: My stay at the hotel was for both business and personal --- the staff was there for my every need! I had a wonderful time at the bar with an attentive staff and great service! My massage was delightful and very well delivered, as well as the glass of wine that was there afterwards!
reviews.title: Dubai hospitality comes to NYC

reviews.text: The staff arranged for a salon to wash and blow out my hair directly after the massage so that I would look great for the theater that evening! I did not bring my dog this time, but I can see that they offer a wonderful pet service with amenities like dog walking as Central Park is right across the street! The hotel has an upbeat energy and great location for serious shopping!
reviews.title: Good location and nice rooms, that's it!

reviews.text: The rooms were comfortable, well equipped, and well attended to! Never a disappointment!
reviews.title: Pathetic Service for a 5 Star

reviews.text: Great location on Central Park South. Rooms are very nice. Bathrooms huge with lots of space for toiletries and include a nice sized tub in addition to shower. Flat screens with all kinds of visitor info in rooms. Service in hotel was very good.
reviews.title: Great Location, great rooms and bathrooms, good service

likes.disliked: — no complaints, bathtub did not drain properly but was fixed immediately

reviews.text: We enjoyed a great stay at the Jumeirah Essex House hotel in December to welcome in the new year.
reviews.title: Excellent Essex

reviews.text: I must admit I was a little dubious after reading some earlier reviews but thought as we have stayed at the Jumeriah's sister hotels in Dubai (namely the Burj Al Arab Hotel) on several occasions and had never been disappointed
reviews.title: Exceptional Essex!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: that we would keep our reservations. We are so glad that we did!
reviews.title: Will definitely come back to the Essex House

likes.liked: — The staff and the room, both were excellent
likes.disliked: — Wish I had a better view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival we were greeted with a warm smile and advised our suite was ready immediately which was nice after a long journey.
reviews.title: Wonderful 40th Birthday!

reviews.text: Jumeirah's Essex House is located on Central Park South, so you have easy access to 5th Ave shopping, the Theatre District, Central Park and the Museums in the Upper East and West Sides of Manhattan. The hotel just completed a renovation so the rooms are fresh and updated and they have a unique art deco-modern elegance in both comfort amenities and style. South Gate has a wonderful decor and atmosphere with windows fronting Central Park.
reviews.title: great place for NYC Holiday visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk staff is always friendly and welcoming, although Guest Services are sometimes hard to reach. This hotel offers a great NYC Holiday experience by maintaining the charm and understated elegance that has made it a landmark since the 1930's.
reviews.title: Lackluster

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have a made a tradition of visiting NYC during the holidays. Because of the location near central park and 5-star status we'd thought the Jumeirah Essex House would be ideal. Sorry to say we were very disappointed. This was going to be a short overnight stay and were excited to pack everything in with as much time as we had. We arrived early in the morning and waited until past 4pm to get into our room. We did go out around town while we waited but never got a promised call about our room status... the front desk said they would call us when the room became available. When we came back at the check-in time of 3 pm, the room was still not ready. And we weren't the only ones. The lobby was filled with guests waiting for rooms. When we finally did get our room, the person at the front desk explained "sorry, we're very busy". Really? Hotels in NYC are busy around the holidays? I requested a park view room but once in our room all we could see were the tops of trees. All the high floors were apparently occupied and we just couldn't wait any longer for any of those to be ready. On past trips, we had stayed at the Parker Meridien and had fantastic park views at almost half the price and little waiting. The topper was the next morning when I tried to take a shower and all that came out was cold water for over 5 minutes. At over $800 per night, I think I'm entitled to a hot shower without waiting unnecessarily for the water to warm up. At check out the next morning, I explained all this to the front desk and got another apathetic apology. I would have been fine with all of this if anybody just made an attempt to make things right. It's as if no one cared if we ever came back... which we won't.
reviews.title: Not up to the usual Jumeirah standard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights in a Manhattan Junior Suite on the 28th floor and in terms of location is superb for shopping, theatre and dining.
reviews.title: Great location, big rooms, nice but pricey.

reviews.text: Having paid $600 a night for the suite we expected the amenities to be better, there was no complimentary water, no glasses for the mini bar and only 2 water tumblers were provided.
reviews.title: always an irritating hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have used trip advisor many times to find hotels when I travel, but this is the 1st time I felt obligated to send in a review of my own. My wife and I spent the weekend at the Jumeriah Essex House and loved every minute of it. The staff was courteous and always available. The room was wonderful, with the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The location could not be more fantastic.
reviews.title: Awesome experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all we had a fabulous experience and I wound highly reccommend this hotel to anyone for future visits to New York.
reviews.title: Short But Sweet Stay

reviews.text: We had been recommended this hotel by some friends...and we were not dissapointed.
reviews.title: Not worth the price
Do not stay here
reviews.text: When arriving at the hotel we were greeted by happy smiling faces and lovely lively music!!

reviews.title: Staff live up to the rude NY reputation!
reviews.text: The only problem we encountered was a delay in the room being ready - this is happening more and more these days... but the room was worth the wait...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Special thank you to Claudia (spa therapist) for my wonderful massage and facial. The facial was especially wonderful. I didn't expect such great attention since I only paid for the basic package of 30 mins for each treatment but I felt each treatment was over the top. Really made my trip to New York extra special. I felt very relaxed and energized at the same time. Great job! Also, thank you Gaylen (spa manager) for making me feel welcome. We loved our stay at the Essex Hotel, excellent location across from the park, bed was very comfortable, everything was just great.
reviews.title: Loved my spa experience

reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights from the 28th October. I booked this in March this year and paid the additional money for a Central Park view queen room so imagine my disappointment to be told the only room available was on the 3rd floor and there would be nothing higher until the next day. We went up to the room and were presented with a view of the tree trunks in the park which didn't fit with my image of waking up in the morning and opening the curtains and looking over the park. We complained and they miraculously found a room on the 6th floor which was also much larger. All that said you don't go to New York to sit in your room which was both clean and comfortable but make sure you ask for a higher floor when booking. The food and drink is expensive but if you go out of the rear entrance, turn right walk up to 7th there is a great organic bakery that does a fantastic breakfast directly opposite.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a great location

reviews.text: I checked into this hotel because of AMEX fine hotel program. Didn't get a room for five hours. When I did then bathtub didn't work. Called the manager who said they didn't have an equivalent room to move me to. Called AMEX and the hotel found a room. Very sad.
reviews.title: Stay somewhere with plumbing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On trips to NYC, we usually try to find the best deal in mid-town. This is the first time we paid up for a luxury hotel and we maybe hooked for good. We loved everything about the Essex House. We had a beautiful room, large by NYC standards with a beautiful bath and walk-in closet. The location cannot be beat, across the street from Central Park, one block from Columbus Circle and three blocks from Lincoln Center and in the middle of several great restaurants. One word of caution, don't bite on the view of Cental Park hook! Since it was fall, we paid up for a view of Central Park. Not only that, but paid up for the additional "deluxe" view. If you stood way over at the very side of the window, you could see on corner of the park! I am told the rooms on the opposite side of the hotel are very nice, a bit larger and less money. We will do that next time, because we will certainly be going back to Essex House.
reviews.title: Great place, great location on Cental Park, South

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Incredible hotel overlooking Central Park and close enough to walk for Thanksgiving Parade. We had a King room facing Central Park. Close enough to open our room window and hear sounds of the carriage riders entering Central Park. Hotel has been updated. First class.
reviews.title: Thanksgiving

reviews.text: i stayed at JEH for 6 nights in early november. rate wasn't great...paid 679 for not even a parkview but november rates were through the roof at other hotels as well. this is my third visit to this hotel. frankly, with the remodel, drop-dead location on the park and friendly staffing, i don't want to stay anywhere else. i go to new york to hit the theatre heavily. and this hotel enables you to walk there for a comfortable 20 minute walk...nice to not have to battle to find a cab. the cabs are pretty busy on central park south. only issues i had with the hotel are that it is too high tech for it's own good. the tv mysteriously came on every hour in the night and i had great difficulty turning it off...i finally had to unplug it. the lighting in the room is tricky to figure out, the high tech phones were confusing and the calking was sloppily caked around the grout line of the tub and the toilet ran a lot. the engineer and plumber were called for the tv and toilet issues but they didn't succeed to fix it. I'm not a very picky person so by unplugging the tv at night and closing the door to the bathroom so i wouldn't hear the toilet running, i was o.k. with this slight annoyance. I didn't want to move my room at this point so never asked if this was an option.
reviews.title: some service issues but overall great hotel...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i did use the complimentary bike to ride through the park which was lovely and greatly enjoyed the restaurant...a beautiful little place to have breakfast and dinner...great food by the way. so all in all, once they figure out the problems mentioned above, the hotel will be perfect.
reviews.title: so dissapointed
No Essex girls here
reviews.text: To finish our holiday in the States we booked for two nights with a Central Park view with telescope. We were given a room on the third floor so of course a telescope was a complete waste of time. We had really been looking forward to the views over central park (like you see in the films) so phoned down straight away to ask for another room but was told they were full!!! The room was quite small which we expected for New York. Everything was brand new and pristine but too fancy for its own good - the TV is connected to some sort of strange set up and impossible to change channels - really weird!! The lights can be controlled on a screen but so difficult to use and then there are lights that come on by themselves by the bedside tables. These high tec things drove us mad!!! The next day we checked out as we could not bear the thought of spending half an hour to get the lights to turn off!!!

I stayed at the Essex House in a wonderful room overlooking the park - it is definitely worth splashing out a bit extra for the view. I can't wait to go back when there is snow on the ground. The park view rooms come equipped with telescope so you can see whats going on in the park, muggings, stabbings, rape... no only kidding, I felt surprisingly safe walking around shopping and sightseeing on my own and walked across the park a couple of times.
reviews.title: Nice Location, Terrible Service

reviews.text: The Essex House is a lovely art-deco relic of a bygone era. Slightly reminiscent of Claridges in London. The staff are unfailingly polite and nothing is too much trouble.
reviews.title: Solid hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For our second trip to NYC we have chosen the Jumeirah given its unique blend of a historical building with a recent major renovation and its extraordinary view on the Central Park. We booked two special offers on the hotel website: the week-end package as well as the NY Waterfalls package.
reviews.title: A memorable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at 4:30 PM. Our room was not ready yet and the reception proposed another room or to come back after 6 PM to make sure our room will be ready. Given the proximity of the Central Park, we chose the second option and took advantage of making our first shoots at Central Park. Upon our return, we had the nice surprise to be upgraded to a suite on the 32nd floor. We found the Reception highly efficient with immediate attention given by four staff members of different origin to cater for the hotel's diverse customer profile.
reviews.title: Great location but remarkable for excelling at nothing else

likes.liked: — The street address - on Central Park South

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had dinner at the recently opened hotel restaurant South Gate which looks cool and trendy. We appreciated the food, less the wines by glass, even so their $ 14 ++ entry price would let you expect some highlights. The Sauvignon first ordered had a strange and unpleasant taste, the Chardonnay suggested by the waitress as a replacement was acceptable.
reviews.title: outstanding

likes.liked: — most comfortable bed, great sheets and pillows
likes.disliked: — couldn't put anything in the sensored fridge. Wanted to charge $35 to put an extra fridge in room.

reviews.text: The suite was spacious with 4 windows allowing different photographic angles. The living was comfortable with a wall flat screen and office / make-up space and two windows. You will find one picture of the living with no backlit adjustment as to allow to appreciate the view on the Central park from inside the living.
reviews.title: not so great stay

likes.disliked: — view, breakfast problems, connected rooms not connected

reviews.text: A nice king size bedroom had two other windows: one full Central Park view even from the bed and a view on the SE corner.
reviews.title: Quit, luxurious and attentive staff, what is there more to ask!!!

reviews.text: We just returned from three nights at the Essex House in NYC, and it was very nice. In recent trips we've stayed at the Parker Meridien, the Michaelangelo and the Soho Grand, and liked them all. At the Essex House, my husband and I stayed in a park view King on the 14th floor and our kids stayed in a two-queen bedded interior room on the 14th floor, not connecting. Both rooms had been redone nicely, although the kids' room (1425) had a nicer and larger bathroom than ours (1405). Our king room was small as compared to the Michaelangelo, but not compared to the Parker Meridien. We borrowed the hotel's four complimentary, first-come, first-served bicycles to tour Central Park. This was great, even though two of the bikes were a little small for our boys. The location of the hotel on Central Park South between 6th and 7th makes it ideal for exploring or running in the park. We found all the staff to be friendly. We enjoyed the expensive but very nice breakfast buffet ($37). We enjoyed the bar with views right onto Central Park South. Only negatives: there is quite a space under the hotel room doors so when drunken partiers come in at 3 am you get to enjoy their conversation as the pass by your door, and our kids room was right next to an elevator, which did emit some mechanical noises. This is tough for me, a light sleeper, but never bothered our kids. Final negative is that it seems as though there was more of a line at the front desk than there should have been for a property at this price point. However, I must say that our kids' room was really large for NY and with two queens and a large bathroom, a great option for people sharing a room. They had three large windows that looked out onto nothing, but which brought the light in. Apparently, the highest floor on which these two queen rooms are available is the 14th floor. There are many different types of rooms and views in the property, so you may want to call the hotel directly. I only wish that accommodations in NY were not so expensive- -these two rooms were not cheap.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Essex House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are new to NYC then this hotel is in the perfect location. It is right on the south side of Central Park and you walk out the front doors and see it every day. Plus all the taxi drivers seemed to know it, no mean feat considering the number of hotels in the city.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Bed Ever!

reviews.text: Apart from the location the only other thing that set this hotel apart, in my opinion, was the fantastic bed (and pillows). It was unlike any bed I have ever slept in. To say that I felt like I was floating on a cloud is no exaggeration! We almost asked the concierge if we could take it with us.
reviews.title: Great historical hotel

reviews.text: Not that I am a fussy sleeper but usually, as many people will experience, the first night in a strange city/bed/etc. is usually not that restful. During my long, hectic w/e however, I always looked forward to falling into that wonderful cocoon every night (can't believe how tragic this sounds but it has to be said).
reviews.title: Still a good bet in NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The ensuite was a little peculiar, I'm sure the toilet seats were heated but the bf said it was my imagination. However, it was a nice touch in the cold spring weather. Only gripe was the shower seemed to have two settings: scalding hot or 3rd degree burn.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at the Essex

reviews.text: We stayed when it was still called the Westin/Essex, but it's still the same property.
reviews.title: Perfect New York Experience

reviews.text: Years earlier we stayed at a cheap Times Square Hotel and got a cheap experience, so this time we wanted to stay where all the places we wanted to visit were located and we extremely pleased.
reviews.title: Best New York Stay Ever!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was marvelous to come from the airport straight to a swank Hotel Directly on Central Park South. The lobby was beautiful.
reviews.title: Could be so much better. . . . .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our reservations were mixed up (three of us), and they said they could only take two. I've learned the hard way to be polite but firm and stand my ground, showing them the reservation, and they eventually upgraded us, seeing my resolve.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

likes.disliked: — They know how to charge for everything!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were delighted with the room, large, spacious, with an INCREDIBLE bed that was like sleeping on clouds. We were even more delighted when the roll-away the brought for our teen was, incredibly, ALSO a luxury bed! I've never seen a luxury roll-away before!
reviews.title: Second time around...not coming back
Could be Excellent....
reviews.text: I arrived at the hotel a few hours before my husband so I checked in and stored my luggage at the bell desk. The woman helping me check in had to ring the bell about 5 times while 5 bellhops stood around in the lobby area talking. None of them even realized that she was trying to have one of them come over to take my luggage.

I stored some belongings in a safe deposit box before exiting the hotel. The safe room is so old and I could see that some of the safes appear to be missing their boxes. That was such a strange sight.
reviews.title: Classic Essex

likes.liked: — Beautiful accommodations in a fabulous location

reviews.text: When I finally checked into the room, I went to the bathroom to wash my hands and noticed that my shampoo and conditioner bottles were both missing some liquid. It was OBVIOUS that some past guest had used a small amount and then instead of throwing the bottles away, housekeeping re-sealed them and put them there for the next guest to use. Appalling. This made me wonder if there were other "cut corners". I checked the sheets thorougly before climbing in!!
reviews.title: Bad Experience at this Hotel!

reviews.text: The ceiling in the bathroom had not been re-finished and looked like it didn't belong with the rest of the decor. I have no idea how a hotel finishes it's rooms, but then fails to completely re-finish the bathrooms. yuck. (this bathroom's celiing was worse than the ceiling in the other bathroom we had 2 month's prior).
reviews.title: loved the Essex house

reviews.text: We decided to stay in the city over this thanksgiving to avoid cooking a large meal for the family and instead see the parade in person. Overall the room itself and the location of the hotel is great, pretty much a quick walk for anything in midtown, and a cab ride for anything below 42nd or above 72nd street.
reviews.title: Excellent Location, Fabulous Views, Mediocre Staff

reviews.text: When we checked into the hotel, the upgraded room we requested was available to a central park view suite, and the upgrade was absolutely worth it. You could see all the way north up to westchester while all of the upper east and west side was in view. The room was very clean and large with a separate living room, pullout couch, dining area, foyer with two closets, large bathroom with a separate shower and bathtub, and a king bed. The furniture was very well kept and very comfortable. The only downside to the room was the phone and lighting system. I have stayed in hotels with very nice lighting systems that were simple and not complex like in the trump hotel in chicago, but there were switches in my room that didn't do anything and all of the switches didn't turn off all of the lights. The one nice feature was a light that automatically went on at night by the bed if you needed to get to the bathroom. The phone system at the hotel however was just too complex, and half the time didn't work properly, and a simple hotel phone would have just sufficed.
reviews.title: Short stay at Essex House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The biggest downside to this hotel was the staff. When we checked in the staff was just fine, prompt, and efficient like any new york hotel. The only real department that deserves a shout out would be the housekeeping, they really kept the room clean and would quickly bring anything we needed. However the bell staff was lacking. When we arrived at the hotel there was no bellman standing on the street to help us with our bags, and it took them five minutes to get someone to bring over a cart. This was unacceptable as the hotel is on central park south and to leave a car standing on any curb in manhattan is always dangerous. When we checked out, the bell staff just didn't show up, and we decided to just bring our bags down ourselves.
reviews.title: Serious Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall I would stay at this hotel again because of it's convenient location to everything and the views it offers from its rooms, but if you can spend the extra 500 per night, stay at the trump, mandarin oriental, ritz carlton, plaza, or pierre, all hotels with much better service than this one.
reviews.title: This place is good, but it could be great!

reviews.text: P.S. Avoid the hotel restaurant, a real disappointment and completely overpriced (a breakfast for 3 people was $140 with tip), there are many other great restaurants for breakfast like le pain on 7th avenue for a fraction of the cost and the same quality, and for dinner like masa on the corner of central park south and columbus circle, jean-georges (if you want to spend the money) at the Trump, or seasonal on 58th street (across from the hotel's other entrance).
reviews.title: Nice location

reviews.text: This would have received an excellant rating, however, the price paid relative to amenities is not worth it. The hotel has a great location, beautiful lobby, and nice modern rooms. however, my room was a shoebox. the bathroom was nice, but the tub was old and cauking peeled away. the good features were the automatic lights when you walk to the bathroom, they turn on. very helpful for those nighttime visits. Did not eat in the restaaurant, but the bar was very modern and the staff friendly and helpful. This would have received an excellent rating if it were $300/night, but at $700, i would expect a bit more.
reviews.title: very nice, not incredible for the price
Awesome!
reviews.text: Just returned from a fantastic trip to New York and stayed in a suite on the 33rd floor of the Jumeirah Essex House. We had a manhatten view, but from the lounge you could see central park and the skating rink. Despite a couple of teething problems with the room, the hotel staff were attentive and quick to sort out any problems. Breakfast was quite expensive - 33 dollars each for buffet and there wasn't a massive choice, sometimes you had to queue as there weren't many tables. There are many places out and about you can get breakfast for a fraction of the cost. Concierge were very helpful in recommending a local Italian restaurant and even booked a table for us. The hotel is ideally situated so you can walk to most things - 5th Avenue, Rockefellar, Empire State, Theatre District and Times Square. The tube is quick and cheap for longer journeys (and you don't have to tip!!) also the hop on hop off tours are a good way to see a lot in a short space of time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate at the hotels newly opened restaurant Southgate and the food was reasonably priced and very tasty indeed. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. p.s. the beds are soooo comfortable and our bathroom was lovely and bright and clean. (after our 1 week stay i just mastered the hi-tech lights!)
reviews.title: Views amazing... service not so

likes.disliked: — Some parts of the room and service let it down.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you have never been to New York before then beware of the the tax added to most things and also gratuity - some restaurants can automatically add up to 15-20%!! which is a lot!
reviews.title: Jumeirah Essex House delivers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: p.p.s. Pre-book as many things as you can before you go - especially statue of liberty - get reserve tickets to beat the one and a half hour queue and if you want to go inside the lower area of the statue you need to get monument tickets.
reviews.title: Memorable Hotel

reviews.text: My Husband, myself, and our 4 year old son stayed here for two nights before heading to my in laws in PA for Christmas. I wasn't sure if this Hotel would be suitable for a family style or the Business travelor. We were so pleasantly surprised! The rooms were brand new and large! We even had a view of Central Park. Breakfast was included daily and we felt like we were royalty. We also participated in the Gingerbread tea in the afternoon after all day out in the city, and it was a perfect respite before a late night dinner. We were so comfortable at this Hotel I would highly recommend it! The staff was overly helpful and so polite! It was like I was in another world!
reviews.title: Outstanding!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Gilroy, Ca
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked the hotel well in advance to spend a special weekend getaway. The rates were high, but extremely competetive with what else was offered in the city and much lower than comparable hotels, like the Ritz around the corner.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but expected more...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived the attention to detail and friendliness of the staff was outstanding. My partner had a birthday and I casually mentioned that at time of booking and on the evening of the birthday we had to our surprise a lovely cake waiting for us. Our requests for ice, extra glasses etc. were taken care of in minutes and the lady giving the wake up call in the morning even mentioned the weather (it's snowing outside). Very impressive. The Lobby is grand and the rooms are stunning. I especially loved the extra comfy beds and large mirrors in the room. Having Central Park right outside just adds to the fantastic value. We had a romantic dinner once in their restaurant (which is quite hidden). Food and service was great, couldn't have asked for more. Will definitely stay there again when in New York.
reviews.title: Celebration spoiled by staff

likes.disliked: — Staff's inability to read documented requests and deliver on them

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have been to NY 5 times before, we have always stayed near Times Square/Broadway. As this will be the last visit for a few years, we wanted to try nearer Central Park for a change. Did a bit of shopping around on the internet and brochures, finding the Essex House to be one of the better hotels.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel & staff - they go out of their way to please!

likes.disliked: — Nasty young woman at Check Out -- everything else was PERFECT!!!

description: Since opening its doors in 1931, the JW Marriott Essex House New York has served as an iconic Central Park hotel, delivering exceptional experiences for its guests. This New York luxury hotel welcomes you with contemporary guestrooms and suites – many affording views of Central Park – that offer distinctive amenities and the latest in technology.
